author: Omar Rashid
text:
The Congress is looking to Dalits to reverse its fortunes in Uttar Pradesh ahead of the 2017 Assembly polls and is reaching out to the community through the grassroots Bhim Jyoti Yatra.

Led by Bhagwati Prasad Chaudhary, Congress ST/SC cell chairman, the party on Monday launched the second phase of its yatra. It will pass through 14 districts of Kanpur, Chitrakoot, Jhansi and Allahabad divisions.

The yatra will cover 84 Assembly constituencies before concluding in Lucknow on February 8.

The main purpose, U.P. Congress chief Nirmal Khatri said, was to correct the “misconception” created around Babasaheb by those looking to seek “political mileage” out of his legacy.

“It is to counter the negative message sent out to Dalits about the Congress and alert them,” Mr. Khatri said.
title: Congress reaches out to Dalits in Uttar Pradesh
